summary: The module defines the core request object used by Django to represent an incoming HTTP request. It parses and stores request metadata such as method, path, scheme, headers, cookies, query string and body, handles multipart file uploads, and offers helpers for building absolute URLs, detecting AJAX or secure connections. It also provides a multi‑value dictionary type for query and POST parameters, an exception for improper raw POST data access, and a few auxiliary utilities for text conversion and host validation.
business_intent: Enable Django applications to access and manipulate all aspects of an HTTP request in a consistent, secure, and convenient way, supporting routing, form handling, file uploads, and URL generation within the framework.
